metadata.disclaimer: Based on publicly available crosswalks and expert analysis. Validate with qualified assessors for compliance/audit use.

clauses.title: Ensured Governance Framework Setting and Maintenance
clauses.rationale: PM-1 program plan; PM-2 roles; PM-3 resources; PM-9 risk strategy. SP 800-53 addresses security governance but COBIT EDM01 covers IT governance broadly (not just security).
clauses.gaps: COBIT EDM01 encompasses enterprise IT governance framework, governance system design, and optimization. SP 800-53 is security-focused and doesn't address broader IT governance structure, value delivery, or stakeholder transparency.

clauses.title: Ensured Benefits Delivery
clauses.rationale: PM-1 program objectives; PM-3 resources; PM-6 measures of performance.
clauses.gaps: Significant gap. SP 800-53 doesn't address IT benefits delivery, value optimization, or portfolio management. Security is one component of IT value; COBIT covers full business value lifecycle.

clauses.title: Ensured Risk Optimization
clauses.rationale: PM-9 risk management strategy; RA-1 risk assessment policy; RA-3 risk assessment; PM-28 risk framing.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 comprehensively addresses security risk. COBIT EDM03 covers enterprise-wide IT risk optimization including risk appetite, risk tolerance levels, and business-aligned risk management beyond security.

clauses.title: Ensured Resource Optimization
clauses.rationale: PM-3 security resources; PM-13 workforce; SA-3 lifecycle resources.
clauses.gaps: Significant gap. COBIT EDM04 covers all IT resource optimization (people, technology, data). SP 800-53 addresses security resources only, not enterprise IT resource planning and optimization.

clauses.title: Ensured Stakeholder Engagement
clauses.rationale: PM-1 program plan communicates to stakeholders; PM-2 assigns stakeholder roles.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT EDM05 covers stakeholder communication, transparency, and engagement across all IT activities. SP 800-53 doesn't address stakeholder engagement methodology or IT reporting to business.

clauses.title: Managed I&T Management Framework
clauses.rationale: PM-1/PL-1 establish security management framework. PM-2 roles; PM-3 resources.
clauses.gaps: COBIT APO01 covers full I&T management framework including organizational design, process management, and continuous improvement. SP 800-53 addresses security management only.

clauses.title: Managed Strategy
clauses.rationale: PM-1 security program; PM-7 enterprise architecture; PM-8 critical infrastructure; PM-11 mission processes.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT APO02 covers enterprise IT strategy, digital transformation, and strategic alignment. SP 800-53 addresses security strategy as a component but not IT strategic planning.

clauses.title: Managed Enterprise Architecture
clauses.rationale: PM-7 enterprise architecture; PL-8 security architecture; SA-8/SA-17 security engineering and design.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security architecture well. COBIT APO03 covers full enterprise architecture (business, data, application, technology layers). Security architecture is one view.

clauses.title: Managed Innovation
clauses.rationale: PM-1 may include innovation aspects; SA-8 security engineering principles.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. SP 800-53 doesn't address IT innovation management, emerging technology assessment, or innovation enablement.

clauses.title: Managed Portfolio
clauses.rationale: PM-7 enterprise architecture includes portfolio awareness; PM-11 mission/business process definition.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT APO05 covers IT portfolio management, investment decisions, and program/project prioritization. Not in SP 800-53 scope.

clauses.title: Managed Budget and Costs
clauses.rationale: PM-3 addresses security resource allocation.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT APO06 covers full IT budgeting, cost management, and financial planning. SP 800-53 only addresses security resource allocation.

clauses.title: Managed Human Resources
clauses.rationale: PM-13 security workforce; PS family personnel security; AT family training. Security HR aspects well covered.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security-related HR (screening, training, roles). COBIT APO07 covers full IT HR management including skills planning, career development, and resource acquisition for all IT roles.

clauses.title: Managed Relationships
clauses.rationale: PM-15 security groups/contacts; SA-9 external system services.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT APO08 covers business-IT relationship management, service catalogs, and customer satisfaction. SP 800-53 only covers security-specific relationships.

clauses.title: Managed Service Level Agreements
clauses.rationale: SA-4 acquisition requirements; SA-9 external service agreements; CA-3 information exchange agreements.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security aspects of service agreements. COBIT APO09 covers full SLA management including service catalog, service level definition, and performance monitoring.

clauses.title: Managed Vendors
clauses.rationale: SA-4/SA-9 acquisition and service requirements; SR family supply chain. Security vendor management well covered.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 comprehensively covers security aspects of vendor management. COBIT APO10 also covers commercial management, contract negotiation, and vendor performance optimization beyond security.

clauses.title: Managed Quality
clauses.rationale: SA-11 developer testing; SA-15 development standards; CM-4 impact analysis; CA-2 assessments.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security testing quality. COBIT APO11 covers enterprise quality management system, QA standards, and continuous improvement for all IT services.

clauses.title: Managed Risk
clauses.rationale: RA family comprehensive risk assessment; PM-9/PM-28 risk strategy/framing; CA-5 remediation. Security risk management well covered.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 is strong on security risk. COBIT APO12 extends to IT operational risk, project risk, and enterprise risk integration. SP 800-53 focuses on information security/privacy risk.

clauses.title: Managed Security
clauses.rationale: PM-1 program plan; PM-2 roles; PM-3 resources; PM-6 performance; PM-9 risk strategy; PL-1/PL-2 planning; RA-1/RA-3 risk assessment; CA-2/CA-7 assessment and monitoring; AT-2 awareness. SP 800-53 comprehensively supports ISMS establishment and maintenance.
clauses.gaps: Minor: COBIT APO13 requires an ISMS approach. SP 800-53 provides controls for security management but isn't itself an ISMS standard (that's NIST RMF).

clauses.title: Managed Data
clauses.rationale: AC-4 data flow; MP family media protection; SC-28 data at rest; SI-12 data management; PT family privacy.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 addresses data security and privacy. COBIT APO14 covers full data management (governance, quality, lifecycle, architecture, metadata). SP 800-53 doesn't cover data quality, master data, or data architecture.

clauses.title: Managed Programs and Projects
clauses.rationale: SA-3 system development lifecycle; PM-7 enterprise architecture; PM-11 mission processes.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT BAI01 covers IT program and project management methodology. SP 800-53 addresses security in development but not program/project management discipline.

clauses.title: Managed Requirements Definition
clauses.rationale: SA-4 security requirements; SA-8 security engineering; PL-2 security plan; PL-8 security architecture.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security requirements definition well. COBIT BAI02 covers all IT requirements (functional, technical, security). Security requirements are a subset.

clauses.title: Managed Solutions Identification and Build
clauses.rationale: SA family covers security in solution development. SA-3 SDLC; SA-10 configuration management; SA-11 testing.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 is strong on security in development. COBIT BAI03 covers full solution design, build, and quality assurance beyond security aspects.

clauses.title: Managed Availability and Capacity
clauses.rationale: CP family continuity and recovery; SC-5 availability protection; AU-4 audit storage capacity.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 addresses availability through continuity. COBIT BAI04 covers proactive capacity planning, performance monitoring, and resource optimization for all IT services.

clauses.title: Managed Organizational Change
clauses.rationale: CM-3/CM-4 configuration change control. PM-1 program updates.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT BAI05 covers organizational change management (people, process, culture change). SP 800-53 CM controls address technical configuration changes, not organizational change management.

clauses.title: Managed IT Changes
clauses.rationale: CM-3 configuration change control; CM-4 impact analysis; CM-5 access restrictions; CM-9 configuration management plan; SA-10 developer change management.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 CM family is strong on IT change management from a security perspective. COBIT BAI06 includes change scheduling, prioritization, and release coordination beyond security scope.

clauses.title: Managed IT Change Acceptance and Transitioning
clauses.rationale: CM-3/CM-4 change control and analysis; SA-11 testing; CA-2 assessment.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security testing and acceptance. COBIT BAI07 covers full change acceptance testing, implementation planning, and post-implementation review.

clauses.title: Managed Knowledge
clauses.rationale: AT family training and awareness; PM-13 workforce development; SA-5 system documentation.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT BAI08 covers enterprise knowledge management. SP 800-53 addresses security training and documentation but not systematic knowledge management.

clauses.title: Managed Assets
clauses.rationale: CM-8 component inventory; PM-5 system inventory; MP family media assets; SA-22 unsupported components.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers IT asset inventory and media management. COBIT BAI09 covers full IT asset lifecycle management including financial tracking and optimization.

clauses.title: Managed Configuration
clauses.rationale: CM family is comprehensive for configuration management: baselines (CM-2), change control (CM-3), settings (CM-6), inventory (CM-8), plan (CM-9).
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 CM family aligns well with COBIT BAI10. Minor gap: COBIT includes configuration repository management and broader IT service configuration.

clauses.title: Managed Operations
clauses.rationale: PE family physical/environmental; MA family maintenance; SI-4 monitoring; CA-7 continuous monitoring.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security operations. COBIT DSS01 covers all IT operations (scheduling, output management, facilities management, capacity monitoring) beyond security.

clauses.title: Managed Service Requests and Incidents
clauses.rationale: IR family is comprehensive for security incident management.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security incidents comprehensively. COBIT DSS02 covers all IT service requests and incidents (not just security). Service desk, request fulfillment, and non-security incident management are gaps.

clauses.title: Managed Problems
clauses.rationale: IR-4/IR-5 incident handling/monitoring; SI-2 flaw remediation; CA-5 POA&M.
clauses.gaps: Major gap. COBIT DSS03 covers ITIL-style problem management (root cause analysis, known errors, proactive problem identification). SP 800-53 addresses incident response but not formal problem management.

clauses.title: Managed Continuity
clauses.rationale: CP family comprehensively covers IT contingency planning, BIA, testing, recovery.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 CP family aligns well. Minor gap: COBIT DSS04 includes business continuity (not just IT), crisis communication, and post-resumption review.

clauses.title: Managed Security Services
clauses.rationale: SP 800-53 comprehensively covers security services: network protection, malware, endpoint, identity management, physical security.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 is strong here. Minor gap: COBIT DSS05 frames security as a service management function with specific security service definitions.

clauses.title: Managed Business Process Controls
clauses.rationale: AC family access controls; AU family audit. Application-level controls partially addressed.
clauses.gaps: COBIT DSS06 covers business process controls including transaction processing integrity, input/output controls, and business process assurance. SP 800-53 addresses system-level controls but not business process controls specifically.

clauses.title: Managed Performance and Conformance Monitoring
clauses.rationale: CA-7 continuous monitoring; PM-6 measures of performance; AU-6 audit review; SI-4 system monitoring.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security performance monitoring. COBIT MEA01 covers all IT performance and conformance monitoring including non-security KPIs, service level achievement, and process performance.

clauses.title: Managed System of Internal Control
clauses.rationale: CA-2 security assessments; CA-7 continuous monitoring; PM-6 performance measures.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 covers security control assessment. COBIT MEA02 covers the full internal control system for IT (SOX compliance, control self-assessment, gap remediation). Broader than security controls.

clauses.title: Managed Compliance with External Requirements
clauses.rationale: CA-2 compliance assessment; PM-1 program compliance; PL-4 rules; SA-4 contractual requirements.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 addresses security compliance. COBIT MEA03 covers all external IT compliance (regulatory, contractual, standards) including compliance program management and impact assessment.

clauses.title: Managed Assurance
clauses.rationale: CA-2 security assessments; CA-7 continuous monitoring; CA-8 penetration testing.
clauses.gaps: SP 800-53 provides security assurance. COBIT MEA04 covers enterprise-wide IT assurance planning, independent assurance, and assurance reporting for all IT objectives.
